HTMLSourceElement.summary: The HTMLSourceElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating {{htmlelement("source")}} elements.

remarks.para:
-The HTML element implementing this interface: source.
-The HTML DOM APIs of the elements that can contain a {{HTMLElement("source")}} element: , , .

HTMLSourceElementSrcset.summary: The srcset property of the interface is a string containing a comma-separated list of candidate images.

remarks.para: Each candidate image includes the URL of an image resource to use as the source for the element and optionally a descriptor indicating the circumstances in which the image should be used. The descriptor is either a number followed by 'w', indicating the element width, or a number followed by 'x', indicating the device pixel density.

It reflects the srcset attribute of the {{HTMLElement("source")}} element nested in a {{htmlelement("picture")}} element. It has no meaning and is ignored when it is nested in an {{htmlelement("audio")}} or {{htmlelement("video")}} element, which use the attribute instead.

HTMLSourceElementWidth.summary: The width property of the interface is a non-negative number indicating the width of the image resource in CSS pixels.

remarks.para: The property has an effect only if the parent of the current source element is a picture element.
It reflects the width attribute of the source element.

HTMLSourceElementWidth.value: A non-negative number indicating the width of the image resource in CSS pixels.

HTMLSourceElementSrc.summary: The src property of the interface is a string indicating the URL of a media resource to use as the source for the element.

remarks.para: It reflects the src attribute of the source element nested in an audio or video element. It has no meaning and is ignored when it is nested in a picture element.

HTMLSourceElementSrc.value: A string; the URL of a source resource to use in the element.

HTMLSourceElementMedia.summary: The media property of the interface is a string representing the intended destination medium for the resource. The value is a media query, which is a comma separated list of media-types, media-features, and logical operators.

remarks.para: It reflects the media attribute of the source element.

HTMLSourceElementHeight.summary: The height property of the interface is a non-negative number indicating the height of the image resource in CSS pixels.

remarks.para: The property has an effect only if the parent of the current source element is a picture element.
It reflects the height attribute of the source element.

HTMLSourceElementHeight.value: A non-negative number indicating the height of the image resource in CSS pixels.

HTMLSourceElementSizes.summary: The sizes property of the interface is a string representing a list of one or more sizes, representing sizes between breakpoints, to which the resource applies.

remarks.para: It reflects the sizes attribute of the source element.

HTMLSourceElementType.summary: The type property of the interface is a string representing the {{glossary("MIME type")}} of the media resource.

remarks.para: It reflects the type attribute of the source element.

-
-
-
-

-picture
-audio
